We arrived outside a rather grubby looking building, without any lights on outside, down a badly lit side street, so we immediately assumed it was closed. Upon closer inspection, no, it's open. Inside only two, rather bemused looking Japanese tourist sat just inside the door waiting for their food. I must add at this point, that I've been in sauna's cooler than the inside of this place, so we quickly retreated outside to sit at the somewhat makeshift table. Where we waited and waited and waited...15 mins later still no service (bear in ind we don't even have a drink, so I got up and jokingly shouted through the door, to the two guys who were just sat chatting behind the counter, that they had a couple of hungry customers outside. 
Two minutes later one of the staff emerges and says "sorry - didn't see you there..." (errr hello...we had been inside when we arrived so you knew we were here!)

We tried to view the (...shabby!) menus as no lighting outside (well there was but it wasn't on!), so resorted to using our phone lights. We decided what we were having, I went for the namesake Rocket Burger, my other half I can't remember and extra fries. I asked for a Beer - no beer! Only water or fizzy drinks...mmm. Burger no Beer..this is not looking good! 

10 minutes later the fries touched down - just the fries, no sauce, no knapkins, no cutlery. Still no lighting. The fries (which I have to admit were rather tasty) hastily demolished...still no Burger. Finally the Burger and my partners dish arrive - mmm, from what I can see peering through the dark it looks okay, smells okay, but I really like to see what I am eating. Oh, we have no fries though so we order another portion. Time to get the phone out again. Phone duly propped so we can see, we tuck in - first bite and I have to say it's rather tasty, but boy am I getting in a mess. I look around to ask for knapkins, cutlery - all the things you really need to eat this kind of burger amd would expect to be on the table or brought out to you, except no one around! Oh, there he is across the road on his phone! Five minutes later I have knapkins (after asking) then have to ask again for cutlery - okay, now I can try and crack on. Oh no, wait a minute, still haven't got the second lot of fries (who serves a Burger without fries on the side anyway?) Oh, someone said "let there be light...". Half way through our meal and the outside lights are turned on  (note to staff - if you put outside lights on earlier, you might attract more customers, who otherwise possibly think you are closed!).

My partner finishes their meal, not looking impressed and asks how mine was: "it was alright" was my reply. But where are the extra fries...

I step back inside the oven to ask for our bill, where the staff are now sat chatting to a friend who has arrived and picking away at food in the kitchen in full view (...my second lot of fries I guess!), oblivious that they still have customers outside.

Whatever it was that is meant to be 'original' about this place I don't know and I really cannot understand the 442 excellent reviews. The staff are slow and uninterested, the venue is in dire need of a lick of paint and defintely some air-con inside and a decent set of tables and chairs outside and please, turn on the outdoor lighting (shouldn't have to ask or wait until half way through navigating your meal!) so people can read the menu and see what they are eating.
